item.title: How Apple’s iPhone stands in the current market, or: ‘How we Apples swim’
item.author: Shiang Chin,
item.description: Just before the BlackBerry service collapse on October 10, the analyst firm Enterprise Management Associates conducted extensive research regarding the trend in enterprise mobile device management. This research concluded that more than 30% of BlackBerry users from within large enterprises are …

item.title: The launch of the QE2
item.author: Shiang Chin,
item.description: If central banks could instigate growth by simply printing more money, they would have done so a long time ago. A recent Bank of England (BoE) research report attests to the theory that cash injections are inflationary: while the Quantitative Easing (QE) package of £200bn had an initial …

item.title: A look into the Bank of England’s monetary policy
item.author: Shiang Chin,
item.description: The Bank of England (BoE) has kept rates at record lows of half a per cent for almost two years. Its ‘quantitative easing’ has purchased assets totaling £200 billion in the last eighteen months. Interest in this extremely loose monetary policy sparked recently when the latest UK Consumer Price Index …
